definition[0]: to be in charge of an activity or person, and make sure that things are done in the correct way
definition[1]: to be in charge of a group of people or a particular area of work
example[1]: Shesupervises 26workers in a business with annual sales of Â£4 million.
example[2]: As managing director, he is supervising a portfolio of investments.
example[3]: The fund manager pleaded guilty to failing to supervise properly.
